elements.title: a Scottish prayer book (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that because of violent reactions – such as Jenny Geddes's on 23 July 1637 (pictured) – to a Scottish prayer book, Walter Whitford kept loaded pistols visible to his congregants while using the book?

elements.title: Sophie Germain's identity (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that multiple mathematics competitions have made use of Sophie Germain's identity?

elements.title: Julius Shiskin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Julius Shiskin originated the idea that a recession can be identified by two quarters of negative GDP growth?

elements.title: Sophitia Alexandra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the creation of Sophitia Alexandra, her designers focused on maintaining an innocent appearance for her face?

elements.title: The Flash series finale (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that episodes of Angel, Lost, and The Office inspired the writer of The Flash series finale?

elements.title: Leeds 13 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Leeds 13's attempt at staging a holiday at Leeds University Union's expense was taken literally by the British press?

elements.title: Michaela Foster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Michaela Foster, a New Zealand footballer playing in the 2023 World Cup, is known for her mana?

elements.title: Peter II (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite Peter and Peter III serving for 17 years each, Peter II's tenure only lasted six months?
